content:
• Wednesday, December 12, 2018
  • VVUS

    After hours: VVUS leads gainers, losers include HASI and TLRD

    • Top Gainers: VVUS +6.0%. GSM +5.0%. ESTE +4.6%. VSI +3.6%. ADC +2.8%.
    • Top Losers: AGTC -36.0%. TLRD -28.0%. LLNW -17.4%. TOCA -5.7%. HASI -4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • TLRD

    Tailored Brands plummets after Q4 profit warning

    • Tailored Brands (NYSE:TLRD) sinks after missing Q3 estimates and setting full-year guidance below expectations.
    • Same-store sales by brand: Men's Wearhouse +1.7%, Jos A. Bank +3.8%, K&G +4%, Moore's Canada +1.2%.
    • Gross margin rose 40 bps Y/Y to 44.6% on some leveraging of occupancy costs.
    • Operating income was up 12% to $86M during the quarter to rep 10.6% of total sales.
    • Looking ahead, the company expects FY19 EPS of $2.30 to $2.35 vs. $2.35 consensus after dropping its profit view for Q4. "We saw a softening of comparable sales due to lower transactions at Men’s Wearhouse and that trend continued into November. As a result, we have taken a more cautious outlook on fourth quarter comparable sales for Men’s Wearhouse," notes TLRD management.
    • Shares of Tailored Brands are down 24.86% in AH trading to $15.14.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 5 Comments
  • LLNW

    Limelight Networks slips 13% on trimmed 2018 guidance

    • Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) is slipping, down 13% after hours, after trimming its 2018 guidance and initiating 2019 forecasts.
    • The company cut revenue expectations for this fiscal year to $195M-$196M from a previous $200M-$203M (and below consensus for $202.4M), and cut expectations for EPS to $0.10-$0.11 (below expectations for $0.15).
    • It's also forecasting EBITDA of $30M-$32M (down from $35M-$37M, and below consensus for $36.5M) and capex of $15M-$17M.
    • “Earlier this year, we made the decision to move forward with a video-centric strategy, which led to forgoing certain sources of revenue to focus on more robust, faster-growing opportunities better aligned with our long-term goals," says CEO Bob Lento.
    • "We also underwent periodic repricing of certain major accounts, from which we expect disproportionately positive revenue growth in 2019. Thus, we are revising our expectations for 2018. At the same time, we are increasingly confident regarding our outlook, as demonstrated by our positive 2019 guidance."
    • For fiscal 2019, it's guiding to revenue of $200M-$225M (vs. consensus for $221.4M), EPS of $0.15-$0.20 (vs. expectations for $0.20), EBITDA of $35M-$40M adn capex of $20M-$24M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDCO

    The Medicines Company readies $150M convertible debt offering; shares up 1% after hours

    • The Medicines Company (NASDAQ:MDCO) is up 1% after hours on modest volume on the heels of its planned $150M offering of convertible senior notes due 2024. Price, yield and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Sanofi to exclusively supply active ingredient of avanafil to Vivus; shares up 15% after hours

    • Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) is up 15% after hours on light volume in apparent reaction to its disclosure that Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) unit Sanofi Chimie will exclusively manufacture and supply the active ingredient in ED med STENDRA (avanafil) for all markets where Vivus has commercial rights beginning on January 1, 2019.
    • The new agreement, building on the original supply deal inked in July 2013, will be in effect until December 31, 2023.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZTS

    Zoetis to buy back $2B of stock; shares up 1% after hours

    • The board of Zoetis (NYSE:ZTS) has authorized the repurchase of up to $2B of its common stock. Its current $1.5B program should be completed in H1 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • AGTC

    Applied Genetic Tech's gene therapy fails to show effect in XLRS study; Biogen collaboration terminated

    • Thinly traded Applied Genetic Technologies (NASDAQ:AGTC) is set for a significant down move after announcing unsuccessful results from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial assessing gene therapy rAAV2tYF-CB-hRS1 in patients with an inherited retinal disorder called X-linked retinoschisis (XLRS). Six-month data failed to show any signs of clinical activity.
    • The lack of progress has prompted Biogen (NASDAQ:BIIB) to terminate its collaboration agreement with AGTC in XLRS and three other discovery programs. All rights will revert back to AGTC.
    • Shares, currently halted, will resume trading at 4:30 pm ET.
    • Update: Shares are down 36% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • CTIC

    CTI BioPharma shares halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in CTI BioPharma (NASDAQ:CTIC) pending the release of news.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • OXM

    Oxford -9% after soft guidance

    • Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM) slides after missing estimates with both lines its Q3 report and setting soft guidance.
    • The company sees Q4 revenue of $297M to $307M v. $315M consensus and EPS of $0.96 to $1.11 vs. $1.31 consensus.
    • "We have moderated our fourth quarter comparable sales assumptions from a high single digit increase to a low single digit increase, as demand in our direct to consumer channels over the last few weeks has not been as strong as we previously expected," says Oxford CEO Thomas Chubb.
    • Shares are down 9.2% in AH trading.
    • Previously: Oxford Industries misses by $0.03, misses on revenue (Dec. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • VBIV

    VBI Vaccines readies stock offering; shares down 7% after hours

    • VBI Vaccines (NASDAQ:VBIV) commences a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 7% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • USDP

    USD Partners wins contract supporting pipeline, storage at Casper Terminal

    • USD Partners (USDP +2.6%) says it entered into a three-year agreement at its Casper Terminal with an unnamed new multi-national, investment grade customer.
    • USDP says the agreement will support construction of an outbound pipeline connection from the Casper Terminal to complement its current inbound pipeline connection to the Express Pipeline and an additional storage tank to facilitate blending and staging operations for the customer.
    • USDP says the customer will utilize an existing tank at the Casper Terminal for a three-year term and eventually a second tank for another three-year term, whose construction, if needed, would expect to be completed in H2 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • MDR

    McDermott, Baker Hughes selected to develop Equus gas project in Australia

    • McDermott (MDR +8.5%) and Baker Hughes (BHGE +2.2%) say they signed an MoU with Western Gas Corp. to become the exclusive development partners for the Equus Gas Project in Western Australia.
    • As part of the initial contract, MDR and BHGE will work with Western Gas to advance the pre-front end engineering design and front-end engineering design to final investment decision.
    • MDR says its portion of the contract is classified as "sizable," defined as between $1M-$50M.
    • MDR and BHGE upon FID are expected to undertake the engineering, procurement, construction, installation and commissioning of the entire field development scope under a separate contract.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 16 Comments
  • INTC

    Intel announces Sunny Cove, teraflop integrated graphics

    • Intel's (INTC +1.5%) "Architecture Day" highlights started with the new 3D stacking logic chips called Foveros but didn't end there. Other highlights:
    • The Sunny Cove next-gen CPU microarchitecture for general computing and high-performance AI tasks, which will be the basis for the next-gen Xeon server and Core client processors coming later next year.
    • Gen11 integrated graphics with 64 enhanced execution units (more than doubled from Gen9) designed to break the 1 TFLOPS barrier. Gen11 will come to 10nm processors starting next year.
    • Intel reaffirms plans to release a discrete graphics processor by 2020.
    • New Optane-based products include Optane DC persistent memory, which "converges memory-like performance with the data persistence and large capacity of storage."
    • Previously: Intel develops stackable logic chips (Dec. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 74 Comments
  • SIEGY

    Siemens selected over Bombardier for Via Rail's C$989M train order

    • Siemens (OTCPK:SIEGY +1.8%) beats Bombardier (OTCQX:BDRAF, OTCQX:BDRBF) for Via Rail's C$989M (US$742M) contract to build a new fleet of locomotives and passenger cars for the rail corridor between Quebec City and Windsor, Ont., citing on-time delivery as a key reason for its decision.
    • Siemens also wins a maintenance contract valued at C$23.7M/year for 15 years, for a total value of C$355M (US$266M); the trains will be manufactured at a Siemens plant in Sacramento, Calif.
    • But a Bombardier spokesperson says the New Jersey Transit board had approved a separate deal with the company, without giving further details since the transaction was not finalized.
    • Bombardier was in the race for the NJ Transit order worth $669M to make 113 cars; the contract could be worth as much as $3.6B for 999 cars over several years if all options are exercised.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 7 Comments
  • ORCL

    Oracle sues over Pentagon cloud contract

    • Oracle (ORCL +2.9%) filed suit in a federal court last week alleging that the Pentagon's planned $10B, winner-takes-all JEDI cloud contract is unfair and illegal.
    • Oracle filed a similar complaint with the Government Accountability Office last August. The GAO turned away the protest.
    • IBM was also reported to have filed a complaint with the GAO.
    • Google dropped out of the JEDI fight. Amazon is viewed as the frontrunner due to its dominant market position.
    • The JEDI contract has an initial two-year option with two three-year options and another two-year option so the total might not add up to the 10 years and $10B. But cloud players are still fighting for the title.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 15 Comments
  • VZ

    FCC affirms wireless carriers' right to block texts

    • The FCC has voted to reclassify wireless text messages as an information service rather than a telecommunications service, in a 3-1 decision.
    • The decision is small on its face but meaningful from a legal standpoint: It means wireless carriers have the right to block some messages as they see fit.
    • Proponents, including the FCC's GOP majority, say the change is needed to combat robotexts and unwanted spam messages.
    • But Democrats including dissenter Jessica Rosenworcel worried about censorship: Carriers have the right to "censor the very content of your messages." Nine senators last week cited a short-lived Verizon decision in 2007 to block texts from a group supporting abortion rights.
    • The vote is the result of a process set in motion by Twilio (TWLO +5.7%), which sends texts for companies and which three years ago pressed the FCC to call texts a telecommunications service in order to prohibit "unfettered" blocking of the texts.
    • Major wireless carriers: VZ -2.4%, T +1.8%, TMUS +1.4%, S +2.4%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 63 Comments
  • MAC

    REITs decline as Macerich drops to seven-year low

    • Real estate investment trusts are one of the few declining S&P 500 sectors in afternoon trading as 10-year Treasury yields rise about 2 basis points to 2.899%.
    • The S&P 500 Real Estate Index sinks 1.8% led by Macerich (MAC -4.3%), which touched a seven-year intraday low.
    • Evercore ISI's Samir Khanal cut Macerich estimates  due to loss of Sears rent and lease accounting charges.
    • Other REITs declining are: Simon Property Group (SPG -2.8%), Federal Realty Investment (FRT -2.1%), Public Storage (PSA -2.8%), CubeSmart (CUBE -3%),  Equity Residential (EQR -2.5%), Sabra Health Care (SBRA -2.9%), Ventas (VTR -2.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 21 Comments
  • SPA

    HIMX, VERI and ZDGE among tech movers

    • Gainers: Sparton (NYSE:SPA) +39%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) +25%. Sify Technologies (NASDAQ:SIFY) +13%. Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) +12%. Aurora Mobile (NASDAQ:JG) +11%.
    • Losers: Zedge (NYSEMKT:ZDGE) -16%. SigmaTron International (NASDAQ:SGMA) -16%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) -14%. eMagin (NYSEMKT:EMAN) -9%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • UXIN

    Uxin +24% on shopping festival sales

    • Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) announces it facilitated over 2,000 used car transactions to customers during the first 18 hours of Taobao’s Double 12 Shopping Festival.
    • Uxin recently established its strategic partnership with Alibaba's (NYSE:BABA) Taobao e-commerce site. The result was the Uxin Taobao Marketplace store, which sells a full suite of used car products and services.
    • The announcement and improving US-China trade tensions have Uxin shares up 24.3% to $7.31.
    • Previously: Chinese internet, semis gain on easing trade tension (Dec. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    Bloomberg: Barrick Gold moves toward resolution of Tanzania dispute

    • Barrick Gold (ABX +2.7%) has reached an agreement with Tanzania's government on a $300M payment toward resolving a dispute that has crippled its Acacia Mining (OTCPK:ABGLF) subsidiary, Bloomberg reports.
    • Deal terms reportedly are now being handed off to a tax working group in Tanzania for review, then would need to be reviewed by Acacia’s board and the U.K. listing authority, and then voted on by shareholders; Tanzanian Pres. Magufuli also would need to review the findings to determine whether the deal is in the best interests of the country.
    • A deal would be a major victory for Randgold (GOLD +2.3%) CEO Mark Bristow, who will take charge of ABX in January upon culmination of the merger of the two miners, and is seen as an important first step should ABX decide to buy up remaining shares in Acacia it does not already own.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 12 Comments
  • QTT

    Chinese internet, semis gain on easing trade tension

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) +1.9% pushes U.S. stocks up this afternoon on indications China will ease its "Made in China 2025" plan, which aimed to drive manufacturing growth by raising market share targets for domestic products. The new program could leave more room for participation from foreign companies.
    • Chinese internet-related stocks are among the largest gainers with the movers including (QTT +7.5%), (SOGO +3.2%), (SOHU +6.5%), (BIDU +2.7%), (BILI +3.4%), (BITA +5.1%), (IQ +2.9%), (JD +5.7%), (UXIN +26.9%), and (WB +2.9%).
    • Semis are also getting a boost with the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index up 2.4%.
    • The S&P 500 IT Index is up 1.6% and the Nasdaq 100 gains 2%. Compare: Dow, +1.5%; S&P 500, +1.4%; Nasdaq, +1.9%.
    • Related semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 16 Comments
  • ADAP

    Adaptimmune tech chief to depart next month; shares down 12%

    • Adaptimmune Therapeutics (ADAP -12%) is down on almost double normal volume in apparent response to the announced departure of Chief Technology Officer Gwen Binder, Ph.D. at the end of next month.
    • She was the first U.S. employee in 2011 and was instrumental in the advancement of its cell therapies.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 7 Comments
  • EMES

    Emerge Energy Services and Pacific Ethanol among Energy/Materials gainers; Parker Drilling and Yield10 Bioscience among losers

    • Gainers: Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) +13%. Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) +12%. Endeavour Silver (NYSE:EXK) +11%. McDermott (NYSE:MDR) +11%. Marrone Bio Innovations (NASDAQ:MBII) +9%.
    • Losers: Parker Drilling (NYSE:PKD-OLD) -64%. Yield10 Bioscience (NASDAQ:YTEN) -11%. Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) -8%. Arcadia Biosciences (NASDAQ:RKDA) -7%. Chaparral Energy (NYSE:CHAP) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • CEI

    Camber Energy says pro forma stockholders equity tops listing minimum

    • Camber Energy (CEI +7.5%) says it had unaudited pro forma stockholders' equity as of Dec. 4 totaling more than $8M, which exceeds the $6M minimum required to maintain a listing on the NYSE American exchange.
    • CEI says it has submitted a plan to NYSE American detailing how it plans to regain compliance - including raising stockholders equity above $6M - and currently has until Dec. 15 to do so, although the company anticipates receiving an extension until Feb. 3.
    • The NYSE warnings come on the heels of CEI's recent announcement that it reached a $4M deal to acquire 30K acres of net leasehold land in Kansas.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters bid up 4% after earnings

    • American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +4%) trades higher after analysts are mainly positive in their post-earnings assessments of the retailer.
    • RBC Capital: The analyst team says it was impressed with the quality of sales, but drops its price target to $24 from $28 to adjust for new Q4 estimates.
    • Wolfe Research: "Comps remain positive in both brick-and-mortar (+6%) and e-commerce (+mid-teens). A below-Cons 4Q18 guide disappointed despite continuing to take share with a +MSD comp guide. The Teen segment remains among the most price competitive, and although we believe American Eagle and aerie are dominant in their respective categories, the lack of sustained pricing power in a deflationary segment keeps us sidelined."
    • Telsey Advisory Group: The firm lowers its price target on AEO to $24 from $32 due to the difficult compares setting up for next year and the potential for increased macro risks.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • ACN

    Accenture acquires Adaptly

    • Accenture (NYSE:ACN) will acquire NYC-based digital media services company Adaptly for undisclosed terms.
    • Adaptly launched in 2010 providing tools that let businesses easily manage ads across different social networks. The ad tools have since expanded to include Google and Amazon.
    • Adaptly has nearly 150 employees and a client list that includes Mazda, Sprint, and Prudential.
    • Once the deal closes, Adaptly will join Accenture Interactive Operations.
    • Accenture shares are up 1.4% to $160.52.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • STRS

    Stratus Properties gets construction financing for Kingwood Place

    • Stratus Properties (STRS +2.1%) gets a construction loan for about $32.9M to finance almost 70% of the costs for building Kingwood Place, a $48M HEB-anchored mixed-use development project in Kingwood, TX.
    • The remaining 30% of the project's cost is being funded by borrower equity, contributed by Stratus and private equity investors.
    • The loan replace the land acquisition loan agreement dated Aug. 6, 2018. The new loan will mature Dec. 6, 2022, with the potential for two twelve-month extensions.
    • Previously: Stratus Properties boosts revolving credit facility, extends maturity (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar gets long-term financing for Argentina solar project

    • Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4.5%) is sharply higher after saying it secured $50M in non-recourse project financing for its 100.1 MWp Cafayate solar power project in Argentina.
    • The financing package was arranged by CAF Development Bank of Latin America; CAF and CSIQ have a $75M financing target and are seeking an additional $25M in senior financing, which is expected to close early next year.
    • CSIQ says the Cafayate project is under construction and expects to reach commercial operation in Q2 2019; once energized, electricity from the plant will be sold to Argentina's national wholesale power market administrator and clearinghouse.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • TLGT

    Teligent files Q3 report; shares up 30%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Teligent (TLGT +30.4%) is up more than double normal volume following the filing of its 10-Q for Q3. The company was late with the submission due to the transition to a new auditor.
    • Revenue was up 62% to $18.3M with a net loss was ($3.9M) but the restated report specifies revenues of $16.2M (-1%) and net loss of ($13.1M).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • PKD-OLD

    Parker Drilling enters Chapter 11 bankruptcy

    • Parker Drilling (PKD-OLD -59.5%) files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection; non-U.S. subsidiaries and certain U.S. subsidiaries are excluded from the filing.
    • PKD says it entered into a restructuring support agreement with holders of its securities, including a significant amount of its 7.5% senior notes due 2020 and 6.75% senior notes due 2022, outstanding preferred stock and outstanding common stock.
    • PKD says its proposed plan, which is subject to court approval, reduces two-thirds of funded debt and injects $95M of new, fully committed equity capital through a backstopped rights offering.
    • If the plan is approved, current preferred equity holders and common equity holders would receive reorganized equity and warrants.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 14 Comments
  • CASY

    Casey's General Stores breaks to 52-week high

    • Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY) is called a "best idea" for 2019 by the analyst team at Gabelli (per Bloomberg).
    • The retailer is seen as the most attractive, publicly-traded acquisition target in a consolidating convenience store industry.
    • Shares of Casey's are up 3.0% and hit a 52-week high of $133.42 earlier in the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • LX

    LexinFintech Holdings leads financial gainers; Uniti Group and Gladstone Land among losers

    • Gainers: LexinFintech Holdings (NASDAQ:LX) +22%. Live Oak Bancshares (NASDAQ:LOB) +21%. Blue Capital Reinsurance Holdings (NYSE:BCRH) +14%. B. Riley Financial (NASDAQ:RILY) +10%. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft (NYSE:DB) +8%.
    • Losers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -18%. Uniti Group (NASDAQ:UNIT) -9%. Berkshire Hills Bancorp (NASDAQ:BHLB) -7%. Gladstone Land (NASDAQ:LAND) -7%. Elbit Imaging (NASDAQ:EMITF) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRP

    Heavy Canadian crude price has more than doubled since cuts announced

    • Just over a week after Alberta Premier Notley said oil producers would be required to reduce production by 8.7%, the price of heavy Canadian crude has more than doubled, in some cases rendering Western Canadian Select too expensive to ship south to U.S. Gulf Coast refiners.
    • Alberta’s heavy oil trades at ~US$41/bbl, ~$9 less than on the U.S. Gulf Coast, Bloomberg reports; for a shipper without committed volumes, the price difference is so small that it would not cover the costs of shipping it down either TransCanada's (NYSE:TRP) Keystone pipeline to Houston or Enbridge's (NYSE:ENB) pipeline system.
    • "Everyone is bidding up those barrels to make sure they can cover their pipe space," a Genscape analyst tells Bloomberg. "People are really just hyper-focused on January and that’s why you are seeing these dramatic price moves."
    • Meanwhile, Alberta’s government is seeking expressions of interest for adding crude refining capacity.
    • Building new refining capacity would be a longer-term solution than the short-term move of mandated production cuts in addressing the province's persistent pipeline bottlenecks.
    • Other relevant tickers include CNQ, CVE, SU, IMO, ECA, CPG, ERF, OTCPK:MEGEF, OTCPK:HUSKF, OTCPK:ATHOF, OTCPK:SPGYF
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 86 Comments
  • SPA

    Midday movers and shakers

    • Gainers: Sparton (NYSE:SPA) +39%. Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) +31%. Teligent (NASDAQ:TLGT) +32%. Astrotech (NASDAQ:ASTC) +28%. LexinFintech Holdings (NASDAQ:LX) +22%. Live Oak Bancshares (NASDAQ:LOB) +21%. Galmed Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:GLMD) +18%. Puxin Limited (NYSE:NEW) +16%. 500.com (NYSE:WBAI) +15%. Aridis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARDS) +15%.
    • Losers: Parker Drilling (NYSE:PKD-OLD) -59%. Neurocrine Biosciences (NASDAQ:NBIX) -20%. Neurotrope (NASDAQ:NTRP) -18%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -18%. SigmaTron International (NASDAQ:SGMA) -16%. MYOS RENS Technology (NASDAQ:MYOS) -13%. Tocagen (NASDAQ:TOCA) -13%. Xcel Brands (NASDAQ:XELB) -10%. NeuroMetrix (NASDAQ:NURO) -13%. Akebia Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AKBA) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • SSP

    Scripps wraps up sale of its radio stations

    • E.W. Scripps (SSP +1.8%) closed on the sale of eight radio stations to Lotus Communications for $8M, closing the books on its radio operations.
    • The eight stations are in Boise, Idaho, and Tucson, Ariz.
    • The closing wraps a series of radio divestitures for Scripps, which resulted in gross proceeds of $83.5M (net proceeds of about $55M).
    • All told, Scripps sold 34 radio stations in eight markets over four different transactions.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • FB

    Facebook, ZeniMax settle suit over Oculus VR tech

    • Facebook (FB +3.1%) and videogame maker ZeniMax have settled a lawsuit where the social-media giant was accused to stealing ZeniMax's secrets and technology for use in Oculus virtual-reality products.
    • Terms weren't disclosed, but both companies expressed happiness with the outcome. “We’re pleased to put this behind us and continue building the future of VR,” says a Facebook spokesperson.
    • Oculus Chief Technology Officer John Carmack was previously a ZeniMax employee, and ZeniMax said he used that knowledge to improve the Oculus Rift headset. It also said Oculus founder Palmer Luckey took code and proprietary info to develop Oculus products.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 5 Comments
  • GOLD

    Production resumes at Randgold gold mine in Mali

    • Gold production has resumed at Randgold’s (GOLD +2%) Loulo mine in Mali following a week-long outage over a pay dispute, the head of the union says while warning of possible further industrial action.
    • The head of industry and mines union SECNAMI tells Reuters that workers returned to work after mediation talks last night.
    • The Loulo-Gounkoto mining complex is located in Mali’s gold-rich southern portion; the country is Africa’s third-largest gold producer, behind South Africa and Ghana.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • EAPH

    Easton Pharmaceuticals down 3% on delay in Toronto deal, dispute with Mexican partner

    • In an update for investors, Easton Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:EAPH -2.9%) announces that the anticipated closing date for its acquisition of a Toronto-located boutique hotel has been delayed to allow for the implementation of certain changes to the recently signed contract.
    • In other real estate news, it will not be proceeding with the acquisition of a resort in Greece due to "new information" discovered during the due diligence phase.
    • It has filed a lawsuit against its Mexico distribution partner BMV Medica SA de CV (and its partner Ackerman Pharma of Mexico) claiming breach of contract and misrepresentation, saying that it has advanced more than $1M to the parties for licensing and other in-county costs but has nothing to show for it. They intended to work together to sell Bayer's VS-Sense vaginitis test there but the planned Q1 2019 commercial launch may be jeopardy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • CCJ

    Uranium price set for more gains, BMO analysts say

    • Production discipline from top miners will break the trend of rising global uranium inventories following the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster and cause the first production deficit in more than a decade, BMO Capital analysts say.
    • "The net result is that uranium has entered a period of structural undersupply and we forecast the beginnings of inventory drawdown, which should continue to provide upward bias to the uranium price as we exit the year," BMO's Alexander Pearce writes.
    • Chinese nuclear plans are core to the uranium outlook, and BMO anticipates that Beijing will recommit to its longer term nuclear targets at the upcoming plenary session of the ruling communist party, where economic goals for the next five years are set.
    • Among relevant tickers: CCJ +3.7%, DNN +4%, UUUU +2.5%, URG +4.5%, UEC +3.4%, NXE +2.5%.
    • ETF: URA, NLR

"Towards that extent, we have decided to use our operating cash flows and cash reserves, to make acquisitions and repurchase Ebix stock; as we see buying Ebix Stock as a highly accretive transaction for our shareholders," he adds.

    • China National Petroleum (PTR +2.2%) has suspended investment in Iran’s South Pars natural gas project in response to U.S. pressure and to minimize tensions amid trade talks, Reuters reports.
    • South Pars is the world’s largest gas field, and CNPC’s investment freeze would mark a blow to Iran’s efforts to maintain financing for energy projects amid the re-imposition U.S. sanctions.

  • VIVHY

    Vivendi presses effort to remove TI chairman, Elliott directors

    • Vivendi (VIVHY +2.4%) is looking to remove Telecom Italia (TI +1.9%) Chairman Fulvio Conti, part of its counterattack against Elliott Management, which wrested control of the incumbent telecom from Vivendi earlier this year.
    • Vivendi is TI's biggest shareholder, but lost control of the board in May, and saw its preferred CEO ousted last month in favor of an Elliott boardmember.
    • A demand for a shareholder meeting by Vivendi presents a headache for TI, as the board must agree to such a demand barring any "big impediment."
    • Vivendi is seeking the new meeting "to appoint new financial auditors, revoke five current board members from the Elliott list of 10, particularly those who were involved in these governance issues, and propose five new ones."
    • At stake behind the board tussle: Elliot's demand for a full spin-off of the company's landline network, and Vivendi's resistance to such a split.

    BHP's sale of Chile copper mine called off as buyer backs out

    • BHP (BHP +1.9%) says the sale of its Cerro Colorado copper mine in Chile has been called off after would-be buyer EMR Capital Advisors failed to meet a financing deadline for the $320M deal announced in June.
    • BHP had sought a sale of its smallest copper mine in Chile as part of a push to focus on major operations; Cerro Colorado produced 77,256 metric tons YTD through June, just one sixteenth the output from BHP’s Escondida mine, also in northern Chile.
    • Cerro Colorado has options that potentially could expand its lifespan for decades, but its environmental license runs out in 2023 and after that new terms would need to be negotiated for water use.

  • ADRO

    Preclinical data show dosing sensitivity of Aduro's STING candidate

    • Results from a preclinical study, just published in Cell Reports, underscore the importance of identifying the optimal dose of Aduro Biotech's (ADRO +2.1%) STING activator ADU-S100 in solid tumors.
    • In mouse models, high doses of ADU-S100 effectively cleared injected tumors but may compromise the durability of the anti-tumor effect while lower doses demonstrated optimal CD8+ T cell responses needed for systemic and sustained anti-tumor immunity. Lower doses were also effective when combined with checkpoint inhibitor therapy.
    • ADU-S100 is currently being evaluated in a Phase 1 study as monotherapy and in combination with Bristol-Myers Squibb's (BMY +2.9%) Yervoy (ipilimumab) and in a Phase 1b study with Novartis' (NVS +1.8%) anti-PD-1 antibody spartalizumab.
    • Previously: Investors underwhelmed with Aduro's early-stage data on STING candidate; shares down 11% (Nov. 9)

  • FSLR

    First Solar's 2019 outlook light but conservative, analysts say; shares +2%

    • First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) +1.9% pre-market after providing a 2019 outlook that analysts say was a bit lighter than expected but appeared constructive.
    • Goldman Sachs, which bumped its price target to $48 from $46 and rates the stock at Neutral, says FSLR "sounded a relatively bullish tone on U.S. demand over the next few years while also signaling that Series 6 margins are tracking toward expectations."
    • Goldman sees the outlook as somewhat weak but says FSLR "has tended to be conservative in providing initial annual guidance metrics," and considers the update "constructive enough to allay bear concerns around Series 6 progress and further deterioration in the overall solar cycle."
    • Oppenheimer, which rates the stock at Market Perform, says it is "encouraged to see the strong bookings activity and the company’s focus on diversifying its geographic footprint," and is positive on the stock in the medium and long term but "cautious on where 1H '19 estimates shake out relative to fundamentals and the potential for heavily back-half weighted earnings to limit near-term upside."
    • Raymond James, which also rates FSLR at Market Perform, continues to "have two structural concerns," including "a lack of significant leverage to the non-utility PV growth curve" and "the unclear long-term opportunity for thin film’s economics."
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
